_header: A brief conclusion declare I shall
_description: ‘Count Ugolino of Pisa’ — 254 lines in quatrains

Corning6.First Lines:
A Breffe conclusion declare I schallOf contricion &
                    petyvosnesseHow an erle was brouȝt yn þralThorow treason
                    & wickydnys…
Corning6.Last Lines:
…Doþe þus mater playnely dyscusWithowt fable yt was
                    done yn dede
Corning6.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “A New Chaucer Analogue: The Legend of Ugolino.” 
             Trivium
         2 (1967): 1-16: 1-16.
